Description: Neck and shoulder sherd of East Greek pottery oinochoe; interior: neck glazed with added red band band, reserved below; exterior, cream slip: neck black; below ridge at shoulder join band of short vertical strokes; on shoulder, painted decoration consisting of wild goat (head and lowered back remaining) to left, looking back; pendant drops as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
CVA: "This piece though not incised is late and attributed by Mr. Payne to the Camiran B period. He compares M. d. L. [Monumenti Lincei] XXXII, pl. LXXXII, 1 and 3 from Selinous."
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.449)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (36, pl. 18, 26)
